title: [BUG] SKSurface.Snapshot() returns all pixels as #00000000 on UWP
body:
**Description**

Clearing the canvas with `SKColors.White` then calling `SKSurface.Snapshot()` returns all #00000000 pixels on UWP. However, it works properly on Android.

**Code**

A solution that reproduces the issue can be found [here](https://github.com/daltonks/SkiaSharp.UwpSnapshotBug).

The main part is in the [code-behind](https://github.com/daltonks/SkiaSharp.UwpSnapshotBug/blob/master/SkiaSharp.UwpSnapshotBug/MainPage.xaml.cs) and the [xaml](https://github.com/daltonks/SkiaSharp.UwpSnapshotBug/blob/master/SkiaSharp.UwpSnapshotBug/MainPage.xaml).


**Expected Behavior**

The sample apps both write `Has non-zero color: True` to the console.

**Actual Behavior**

Android writes `Has non-zero color: True`, but UWP writes `Has non-zero color: False`

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.0
- Last known good version:  Not sure
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 9.0
  - UWP:  16299 

- Target Devices:
  - Windows 10.0.18362
  - Android Pie on a Samsung Galaxy S8
